intro: Thesium brevicolle, commonly known as the short-stemmed thesium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, urn-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens. Thesium brevicolle is adapted to well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
